intro: Cieca heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf cieca, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its distinctive, often lobed leaves. This plant is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. Its leaves exhibit significant variation in shape and size, which is a key botanical feature. The flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found growing in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
